title: My Projects
text:
This page will contain info about all my projects that I have done!
Outline:

title: My Projects
text:
Statistics Capstone Project

With guidance from Dr. Rodolfo Lourenzutti, I worked for a client analyzing changes in glaucoma eye surgery in an apprentice type of job.
Real client work, regular meetings with the professor presenting work, poster board and oral presentations
Produced reports, coding, and worked directly for the client using the R coding language and GitHub
Learned about complications with study design, model selection, and effective communication
See poster board session listing: https://www.stat.ubc.ca/poster-session-stat-450-2

title: My Projects
text:
The Daily Grind (CMD-F Hackathon)

March 8-9th, 2025, 24 hour hackathon
Winner of “Social Track” in a 24 hour hackathon, Won 3rd place overall, with 50+ projects and 200+ participants
Presented work to 7 judges individually, and in the final round presented in front of the entire hackathon community.
See the project at: https://devpost.com/software/the-daily-grind

title: My Projects
text:
Easy EDA (Personal Project)

Personal project such that you can “automate” EDA for any given dataset.
I hope to make an R package such that functions will quickly and easily create proper plots based on data types, for any and all columns. All code will be done with R initially, but will expand to Python too, for interactive visuals.
Link to the Repo

title: My Projects
text:
DSCI 310 Group Project

Create a statistical analysis that incorporates these main ideas:

Data Pipelines
Make and Makefiles
Dockerfiles
Creating an R Package

See the repository here: https://github.com/DSCI-310-2025/dsci-310-group-7-data-dudes

title: My Projects
text:
Weather Extremes Research

Working at UBC from May to August 2024 under an URSA NSERC scholarship
Working under professors Harry Joe and Natalia Nolde, I found patterns and explanations for climate extremes.
Dealt with Canadian weather data, relating to floods, droughts, and wildfires using Python and R languages.
Completed EDA and used various statistical analyses to gain insight into weather patterns and time series analysis.
Analyzed many research papers, presented work weekly, and assisted both professors with various tasks.
Will be publishing work on a public repository soon!

title: My Projects
text:
ASA DataFest

A 48 hour hackathon in a team of 3
Created a fully reproducible project, with a clear statistical analysis
Created a dashboard, demonstration video, presentation using quarto, and analysis using a bayesian model
Project topic and workcan only be revealed after May 3, 2025
Info about ASA DataFest: https://ww2.amstat.org/education/datafest/



NOTICE!
Please know that I am still updating this website… It will be finished soon :)

title: All About Websites!
text:
This is my first website, so here I will talk about important info I learn here!

For basic information on Quarto websites I started with: https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

Any special customization that I do, I hope to outline here as a guide to making your own!

Markdown tips

To receive the outline shown on the right-hand side of this page, specify in the YAML header the following: toc: true.



Styling and Rendering

Create a styles.css file (in the same directory as your index.qmd file) to create custom HTML styling.

For example, the way I created the purple box shown at the bottom of this page is done by putting the following in the styles.css file:


.purplebox {
    background-color: #e3dfff; /* Light Purple */
    border: 3px solid #7a5fa3; /* Dark Purple */
    color: #3d236f; /* Text Color */
    padding: 10px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    text-align: center;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-family: sans-serif;
  }

Which you can then execute by putting this in your document:

:::: purplebox
::: center
**NOTICE!**\
Please know that I am still updating this website... I hope to finish it soon :)
:::
::::

You can create a dropdown menu by doing the following HTML code:

<details>
<summary>Dropdown title</summary>
Contents you want inside the dropdown menu
</details> 
Which looks like:


Dropdown title

Contents you want inside the dropdown menu



NOTICE!
Please know that I am still updating this website… I hope to finish it soon :)

CPSC 110



Math

MATH 101
MATH 100



Business

COMR 398

An organization’s ultimate success depends on how efficiently and effectively it executes its strategic goals. This requires a detailed understanding of the processes used to produce and deliver goods and/or services to customers including:

process analysis
queuing systems
project management
inventory management
supply chain management

Upon successful completion of this course, students will have the managerial tools needed to understand and articulate the impact of an organization’s business processes, and the ability to analyze and continuously improve these business processes.

title: Heidi's Portfolio
text:
About Me
Hello!
I’m Heidi, a BSc. student at UBC, graduating this May!
I am majoring in statistics and have a minor in data science.
My interests involve consulting, data visualization, actuarial science, and data engineering. Please feel free to take a look through my website to get a sense of who I am and what I like to do!
